description: Borrowed from Middle French subterfuge, from Medieval Latin subterfugium, from Latin subterfugiō (“I flee secretly”), from subter (“under”) and fugiō (“I flee”).

entries.meaning: (countable) An indirect or deceptive device or stratagem; a blind. Refers especially to war and diplomatics.
examples: Overt subterfuge in a region nearly caused a minor accident.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) Deception; misrepresentation of the true nature of an activity.
